fields.description:
While the warning message in the Restore Default Dashboard window on the RestoreDefaultDashboard!default.jspa page tells the user it will delete any pages that have been created - this is not how the function should seem to work when selecting the "Restore Defaults" link from the bottom of the Configure Dashboard page.  

Since a given dashboad is selected (the name is highlighted) when the user selects this - it would be more intuitive if the restore only restored the defaults for the selected page.

Example: I have 2 custom dashboards that were created after the "default" dashboard had been modified.  I would now like to return the "default" back to it's original layout but don't want to lose the 2 custom dashboards.  Unfortunately this is exactly what happens if the Restore Defaults feature is used.
fields.summary: Labeling/function of the Restore Defaults for dashboard

fields.description:
Possibly related to JRA-7596, but a new upgrade/install of JIRA 3.3 doesn't seem to layout properly in Firefox.  Strangely, jira.atlassian.com is laying out appropriately.

Response headers indicate it's text/css (http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257218645&#257218645).  Shift-reload doesn't fix, nor does complete cache clear.

See attached image.

Response headers follow:

Response Headers - http://server.domain.tld/jira/styles/global_printable.css

Date: Fri, 19 Aug 2005 15:36:14 GMT
Server: Apache/1.3.26 (Unix) Resin/3.0.11 PHP/4.3.10 mod_ssl/2.8.10 OpenSSL/0.9.6
Keep-Alive: timeout=15, max=93
Connection: Keep-Alive
Transfer-Encoding: chunked
Content-Type: text/css

200 OK
fields.summary: Firefox Layout

fields.description:
Hello,

as per the subject, our production installation of JIRA is not flushing the mail queue autonomously any more, even with a delay time set of 1 minute.
When I click on the link "Flush mail queue", all mail notifications are sent in a seamless way.
This issue seems to last since yesterday morning.

This morning, I have shut down Jira, emptied the directory /work to force the recompilation of Java classes, and started up Jira again.
However, the mail queue still does not flush autonomously.

Could you please give us support?
Thank you.

Kind regards,
Gabriele Piroddi

P.S. I also posted a support request via e-mail: Brian Nguyen answered me.
fields.summary: JIRA is not flushing the mail queue any more

fields.description:
The System Info page in the admin section will hang if JIRA is run without internet access.  So will 500page.jsp, when an error occurs.  This is because JIRA tries to parse entityengine.xml, and the parser tries to download the DTD (http://www.ofbiz.org/dtds/entity-config.dtd). fields.description:
one of the important tools in the eco-center of software development and issue tracking is test case management. 

Tools such as TestLink, TestMaster, Mercury TestDirector provide a database with the relevant functionality.

Integration to the issue tracker provides a link between tests and the issues they created, are blocked on, etc.

JIRA should have a generic integration to such tools, and specific easy integration to 1 or 2 leading tools.

Best would be if JIRA can provide such a database on its own. Its not a rocket science field, and integrated support can be very interesting.

see http://rndmgmttrenches.blogspot.com/2005/08/building-test-case-management-solution.html for my take on the issue.
fields.summary: Provide integration to "Test Case Management" databases/tools

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-7687].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 2 January 2013|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,

Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue.

This issue has been resolved in our latest bug fix release for JIRA, [JIRA 5.2.4|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+5.2.4+Release+Notes].  The 'None' option no longer appears when the select list is a required field and has a default value.

Thanks for your patience and we hope you appreciate our open approach to feature requests.

Cheers,

Bryan
JIRA Product Management
brollins at atlassian dot com

{panel}
\\
*Original Description:*
Due to fix implemented for JRA-3666 the 'None' option was added even when the field is required.
This makes sure that the user is forced to make a choice for the value instead of defaulting to the top of the list.

However if you have set a default value the 'None' option becomes irrelevant so should be removed.
fields.summary: Remove 'None' option if select list is required and has a default selected

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-7686].
  {panel}


{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 12 November 2012|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,

Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue.

As most of you have seen in the comments below, this issue is resolved in JIRA 5.2!

In addition to making issue search and issue navigation faster and easier to use, text custom fields are now a part of all quick search and simple search text searches.

Thanks for your patience and we hope you appreciate our open approach to feature requests.

Cheers,

Bryan
JIRA Product Management
brollins at atlassian dot com

{panel}

*Original Description*
Currently to search for text in a custom field you need edit the search for each field separately. It would be useful if you could add the custom field to the main text query search, like what is done with comments and environment.
fields.summary: Allow text custom fields to be searched from quick search / text search.

fields.description:
Custom fields don't allow sorting without lucene

This time it's a UI issue. The issuetable.vm checks for:

            #if ($sortingenabled == true && $field.sorter && $field.sortComparatorSource

it shouldn't really check for field.sorter. 

Also need to change the default NavigableField to return null sortComparatorSource when the sorter is null.

Test this using the JIRA Toolkit with the Days since last commented field
fields.summary: Custom fields don't allow sorting without lucene

fields.description:
When a user creates an issue in a project that they do not have permission to see (either through security levels or permission scheme settings), the user is currently directed to a 'Permission Violation' page.

This can lead to ambiguity - has the issue been successfully created or not?

Probably best to redirect the user to a page confirming issue creation but noting that the issue cannot be viewed due to the security/permission settings.
fields.summary: Redirect the user to a suitable page after user creates an issue that they cannot view

fields.description:
On the Project page the Unassigned link under Open Issues By Assignee (right-hand pane) shows 25 issues are Unassigned.  However, when I click the Unassigned link it takes me to the Navigator with over 500 issues listed.

It appears the URL for that IssueNavigator link is missing the 'pid' parameter for my current project.
fields.summary: Project page Open Issues By Assignee Unassigned not working correctly

fields.description: The Jira application fails regularly, every 7 to 10 days.  When this occurs we run the ./shutdown.sh script and then the ./startup.sh to restore the application service
fields.summary: Jira service fails every 7-10 days

fields.description:
We have lost the change history for all issues which were created before we upgraded from Jira v 3.0.2 to 3.1.1.  Any issues created after this date have the change history displayed as normal.

We require the change history so as to track the progress of all issue worked on by developers and it provides an audit trail

Please advise how we can go about restoring the change history for all issues created in the previous version of Jira
fields.summary: Change History lost when upgrading jira version

fields.description:
We are utilising new workflow which we created.  These workflows has "closed" as the final stage of issue lifecycle, and as such do not allow issues to be reopened.  It seems that any issues utilising this workflow generate the following error when using the Integrtiy Checker

Check workflow current step entries 
   ERROR: 	IDT-358 - The workflow entry with id 14048 does not have a corresponding current step. 
JRA-4539 

   ERROR: 	PROD-14 - The workflow entry with id 14379 does not have a corresponding current step. 
JRA-4539

Please advise what needs to be doen to correct this issue
fields.summary: Workflow entry does not have current step

fields.description:
If you use a double-quote character in the description of a component and then try to create a new issue for the project containing this component, the component and version fields are mixed up.
This happens on IE6, not on Firefox.

If you look at the HTML source code, you notice that the full description for the components appear in the OPTION tag, and, naturally, the extra quote character mixes everything up.
fields.summary: Double-quotes in component descriptions break the Create new issue page in Internet Explorer

fields.description: If two projects have overlapping components, I should be able to select those components to filter on, while searching.
fields.summary: Add ability to filter by component when multiple projects selected in Find Issues

fields.description: Can I make a field that is otherwise editable read only on certain screens?  There are some custom screens where I'd like to provide contextual information without allowing them to edit it at that point.
fields.summary: Read Only Views

fields.description:
Currently on the Home page all of the saved or shared filters viewable for a user are displayed in a large list sorted by filter name. Our list is getting large and the filter name does not always indicate the project for the filter.

Instead of displaying saved and viewable filters in a single list can they be displayed in a tree view by Category / Project, similar to the following

Saved Filters
- Category1
    - Project1.1
        Filter1
        Filter2
    - Project1.2
        Filter3
        Filter4
- Category2
    + Project2.1
    + Project2.2
+ Category3
+ Category4

This view would provide instant feedback to the project the filter is for. It would also keep the list short as the user could view only the filters for the projects he cares about at the moment
fields.summary: Sorting saved filters

fields.summary: Version Picker custom field has no available versions when searching

fields.description:
When importing from CSV file, comments are not added unless you give anonymous permission to add comments.
You get the following error message in the logs:

WARN [atlassian.jira.external.ExternalUtils] Anonymous users do not have permission to comment on an issue in project: <project>


Add "Group (Anyone)" to "Add Comment" permission during import to get around this issue.
fields.summary: CSV importer doesn't add comments unless permission is given to "Anyone"
permission to allow update and bulk update of closed issues

fields.description:
We need to move our version of Ipedo to a different machine, is there a process I can work with to make this happen and/or some directions as well?

Thanks
Dustin Baker
fields.summary: We need to move our Jira application to a different Windows 2000 machine.

fields.description:
Hello,

how do I display a field which contains a null value?  Is there a flag I can set or any kind of configuration that I can do to make all the fields that I have configured for a screen/issue type to display?  

Currently some fields are not being displayed until they are actually assigned a user-input value, for us it is usefull to know that this field has not received a value yet.

Thanks,
-Andreas
fields.summary: Allow custom field to display on View Issue screen even with null (no) value
Configuration of ICON sizes

fields.description:
If I email a user with a link to view an issue and use the Permlink function to send the recipient to a particular comment, clicking on that link will indeed launch a URL with the anchor in it. 

But, typically the recipient may not be logged in, so when clicking on the link, they are prompted to first log in. After doing so, the URL launches to browse the issue, but without the anchor that was originally there. It gets lost during the login operation. 

I think it's difficult to show/test on jira.atlassian.com because it's a public instance. See what happens when you put bells and whistles in? :)
fields.summary: permalink anchor in bookmark lost on login

fields.description:
Available keyboard shortcuts are great. I wish there would be more of them.

I miss the most keyboard shortcut for "Comment" function. I think that is the most used function in JIRA (just have a look how many times users commented various issues at jira.atlassian.com).

There is additional reason, why keyboard shortcut for 'Comment' would be welcome. Sometimes I read issue with quite a bit of comments. If I want to add something myself, I need to scroll up to the top of the page, click Comment, and then scroll down back to the bottom of page, to enter the comment.

At this moment, I don't see that such shortcut exists: http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.3/shortcuts.html

Other useful keyboard shortcuts would be:
Start/stop progress
Log work done
Assign
Resolve Issue
Link issue
fields.summary: Update docs for keyboard shortcut to add comment
Grant permissions to watchers

fields.description:
attach to 3.3.1

Thanks to YB Chen for this one!
fields.summary: Traditional Chinese language package for 3.3

fields.description:
There are too many restrictions once a workflow is active:
- Why do I cannot change the conditions, validators etc. of a transition?
- Why do I cannot change the transitions screen assignment?
- Why do I cannot add transitions?
- Why do I cannot remove transitions?

All these changes are not critical to workflow/data consistency.

Seems your workflow framework has stupid technical restrictions. It doesnt fit the requirements of agile development where I change/refine the process 
in many small steps.
fields.summary: Ability to Edit Active Workflow - Editing Workflows is too inflexible

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-7659].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 30th January 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,

Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this feature request. 

Good news! The upcoming release of JIRA 6.2 (planned for the first quarter of calendar year 2014) will introduce the "limited user picker" functionality for single user pickers based on custom fields. The limiting will be configurable based on rules, each rule defining a project role or group from which the users will be displayed. In case of multiple rules, the final list will be the union of lists as defined by individual rules. Rules will be defined within the context of the custom field configuration: therefore they will be separate for each combination of project and issue type.
As mentioned above, the rules definition will be applicable to all user picker custom fields, and as a consequence will currently *not* cover the scenarios for:
* the user picker for system fields of reporter and assignee (JRA-36896)
* the multiple user picker (JRA-36833)

Thanks for your patience and we hope you appreciate our open approach to feature requests.

Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}
*Original request description*

As JIRA user and administrator I want to be able to use a user picker field in such a way that only users from selected groups or roles ale allowed for selection. This way I will be able to limit the choice (which is important in large scale deployments), but also assure that only users who are expected to provide actionable follow up are selected (for instance in case of bugs, these should be only developers and QA, and not sales engineers).
fields.summary: Limit user picker to members of certain groups / roles

fields.description: It would be useful to let a post-function copy a value from a field to another one (incl. custom fields) or assign the issue to a user contained in a custom field of type user picker (== copy value from custom field into "assigned to").
fields.summary: Let workflow transition post-function copy value from one field to another one
Allow workflow transitions post-functions to update custom field values

fields.description:
Basically, when you set the path to the log file, Jira wont create any directories that are required - so you tend to put all the cvs log files in the same directory.

However, the write-lock-file implementation :

final Lock lock = getLock(logFile.getParentFile().getAbsolutePath());

means that the lock-file then becomes global - for all cvs-logs - .... because all log files are in the same directory :-(

You want to:
1) create any directories that are required when saving the log file
2) make the lock-file name contain the log-file name - so that each cvs-log file has its own lock file.... even if they are all in the same directory
fields.summary: CVS Log write-lock-file implementation leads to trouble....

fields.description: When an issue is created over email, the priority is set to be Major even if the issue default priority is configured to be something else. For example, our default for issues created using the web forms is Minor but all issues created over email get priority Major.
fields.summary: IssueCreationHandler doesn't use Jira's default priority

fields.description:
The following exception arises when trying to configure workflow transition postfunctions (display post functions of transition or add a postfunction).


2005-08-16 13:57:25,354 ERROR [velocity] ASTMethod.execute() : exception invoking method 'hasCustomEditTemplate' in class com.atlassian.jira.plugin.workflow.UpdateIssueFieldFunctionPluginFactory : java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: argument type mismatch
fields.summary: Exception thrown when trying to configure workflow transition postfunctions

fields.description:
The limitation of only having two levels in a cascade select field makes it difficult to create screens which adapts to the users selections. Removing this limitation and allowing multiple levels makes it easier to create "selection adaptive" screens.

Another way the same functionality can be achieved is by extending the context for fields from Global/Project/Issue to include selections from a select list/radio buttons (or even a user picker?). This would really make screens work a lot better! 

Extending the field context would give users of JIRA a whole range of new possibilities related to customized screens, and would also extend the possible use cases for JIRA.
fields.summary: Remove limitation of two levels in cascade in cascading select field or extend field context (multi-level cascading select)

I have then on my personal dashboard added a portlet to show my issues by project (using filer statistics, with the statistic type of project), so this gives me some nice bars showing which projects have the bugs. I have had a few requests from people for them to have something simliar so I thought I would just add it to the default dashboard. However when I do this when people aren't logged in they are given the following error mesage on the front page: (When they log in, everything appears as normal)

Instead of an error message appearing I would expect them to just get a little box saying something like "You must log in to see these filter results" or something... I presume it's because I am using the search feature of "currect user" so when no-ones logged in there are no current users and so the fileter returns an error which is then displayed on the screen. {panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-7648].

The buttons on the long issue edit form are way down the bottom.
And you have to scroll all the way down to apply your changes.
Suggest the buttons should be somewhere near the top and NOT scroll with the page contents.
A little tricky to do cross browser, but this is the single most annoying feature we find.
Makes it quite tedious to work with when we are maintaining our many tasks.

fields.description:
In my instance of Jira I have a particular Issue type that I have hidden the Priority field for. This particular issue type also has a service that uses the CreateIssueHandler to automatically generate a new issue. I have discovered that creating a new issue via email actually sets a priority automatically, even though this particular issue type doesn't need a priority set. When a user receives an email reply that an issue has been created, they are shown the issue priority even though this issue type should not have one. 

After looking at the source, it is clear that CreateIssueHandler will set a priority on all issues all of the time. I understand the reasoning for looking at the X-Priority header of the email to determine incoming priority, but in my case I wish you were checking to see if the Issue type even needs a priority. My usage scenario is more of a boundary case, but it would be nice if you considered all fields to be optional. 

 I have modified the source and am checking for my particular issue ID's, but if you could fix this in a future version that would be great.
fields.summary: CreateIssueHandler automatically sets a priority even if the Issue type doesn't have the priority field visible

fields.description:
At the moment, the "From Address" of JIRA e-mail is set by configuring the SMTP server and all the e-mails sent has that same address. However the e-mail actually contains the name of the person who has just done the action. For example:

Anthony Mak(JIRA) default@smtpserver

Is it possible to have the option to use the user e-mail instead rather than the deafult one?
fields.summary: Allow the notification email From address to be set to the Current User's

fields.description:
I am setting up a new project, so first I need to set up a new workflow for it. One of the things I need to do is add a post function to the workflow to automatically assign issues (when being resolved) to a particular user. I will be doing this in conjunction with a field configuration scheme that hides the Assign-To dropdown on resolve issues screen.

Everything is fine except for one thing. In the workflow browser (which was hard to find, by the way) for Transition: Resolve Issue, I choose to Add a new post function to the unconditional result of the transition. Then I choose to "Update Issue Field  ==>  Updates a simple issue field to a given value." On that screen, I choose the field to be "Assign To", and the drop down for the field shows a list of users. All well and good except for one thing. It shows a list of users based on Assignees for a particular project, and it's got a project shown there that I haven't even worked with recently, and isn't even numerically first. It just seems to be a random project.

So, I'm in a catch-22. I can't save the workflow for the project I'm about to create because the user doesn't appear in the drop down. And I can't create the project with that workflow and then change it because I can't edit an active workflow. As a workaround, I added the user I needed to the assignable user list of the project JIRA decided to display, created the workflow, and assigned it, and then removed that user from that group.

But I shouldn't have had to do that. The dropdown should simply display a list of users.
fields.summary: workflow post function dropdown has invalid filter when selecting user
Display uneditable fields on workflow transition screens

fields.description: The assignee field gets lost in re-asignment, especially when filtering and generating reports after the issue has been re-assigned for review etc. Would be nice to have an Owner field, this being the developer/other who always 'owns' the issue throughout the life-cycle of the issue.
fields.summary: The assignee field gets lost in re-asignment. Would be nice to have an Owner field.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-7641].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 21 December 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,

Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this feature request. While this feature is something we want to add to JIRA, it is not on the list of priorities for the next 12 months.

In the meantime, please check out these plugins:
* [Configuration Manager from Botron Software|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.botronsoft.jira.configurationmanager] 
* [Project Configurator from Awnaba Software|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.awnaba.projectconfigurator.projectconfigurator]

on our Atlassian marketplace.  Both of these plugins are available for the downloaded instances of JIRA and solve the use cases outlined in this requirement.

There's also another solution emerging from an Atlassian Exper Catworkx.de. You can check out the [factsheet here|https://www.catworkx.de/produkte/catWorkX%20Produkte/configuration-importer/Configuration_Importer_for_JIRA_fact_sheet.pdf]

Thanks for your patience and we hope you appreciate our open and honest approach to feature requests.

Chur,
Otto Ruettinger
JIRA Principal Product Manager
oruettinger (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}
*Original request description*

Needed features:
- Import / export a project's structure (incl. workflow, related issue types, related groups, permissions, etc.), but not its issues or history. This is useful to copy from the test installation of jira into the productive one.
- Delete all issues and history of a project, but not its structure. Delete all closed issues of a project and their history, but not it's structure. This is useful for test purposes and for cleaning purposes in case of changes that make the old issues not required to read but useful to archive (e.g. for legal needs).
- Import / export / delete a complete project, structure and issues. This is useful for backup flexibility and data cleanup (each dept. of the concern keeps its own data; When Maintenance have made a mistake and need to restore their backed-up data, we don't want to restore Development's data as well).

As a workaround for the lack of these features, we happen to use several installations for test purposes. But our managers definitely won't allocate any money for the corresponding licences, since juggling with several instances of a program is neither efficient nor convenient.

Moreover, for now we end up with either databases full of unneeded, outdated test data, or with hours of click-click-click-copying a project's structure from the test system into the productive environment. (We tried direct manipulation of XML export data or databases, unsuccessfully.)

fields.description:
The URL for a Time Tracking report is missing the selectedProjectId (is it getting it from the session?). 

This means that you cant simply copy and send or post links to a time tracking report.

You can work around this by appending "&selectedProjectId=xxxxx" to your url ... but would obviously be nicer if you didnt have to do this.
fields.summary: Cannot link to Time Tracking Report anymore

fields.description:
The standalone documentation requests that users of Tomcat 5.0.2x install a subset of supporting JARs to $CATALINA_HOME/common/lib. Applying these JARs conflicts with JARs available to the standalone installation as they are older than those available in WEB-INF/lib.

Specifically, step 4 on http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.3/servers/tomcat50.html. This classloader conflict prevents email notification from working, generating MessageExceptions and UnsupportedDataTypeException in mail and activation classes.

Clarification in the Troubleshooting section on jira sub-directories found in $CATALINA_HOME/webapps. Deploying to a new instance of Tomcat 5.0.28 deploys an exploded version of the webapp jar (located else where) anyway. This is possibly a default setting in Tomcat not accounted for in the jira.xml context fragment in the standalone distribution.
fields.summary: Tomcat installation docs need correction (breaks email notification)/clarification

fields.description: A minor nit perhaps, but it would be nice if issue keys could be alpha-numeric.  We have many projects that are derivatives of a root, and it would be nice to specify them as foo0, foo1, foo2, foo3, etc.
fields.summary: Issue keys should be alphanumeric rather than alpha-only

fields.description: If the general configuration parameter "User Email Visibility" is set to Hidden, all users' email addresses are readily displayed on the User Picker pop-up. There could easily be a case where someone would want to allow users to use the user picker popup (which I understand is configurable to be permitted only to some users), but still not see email addresses of all the users. Imagine if you had clients entering support issues being able to see the e-mail addresses of all the company's other clients!
fields.summary: user picker does not respect 'hide email' parameter

fields.description:
We need to have the Description field in our Excel export.  I customized my Issue Navigator screen to have the following columns (in this order):
Type, Key, Created date, Summary, Description, STatus, Priority, Reporter, Affects Version/s, Fix Version/s, Resolution Notes.

Resolution Notes is a custom filed of type Free Text Field.

When we export this to Excel using the Current Fields link and try to print it, Excel hangs indefinitely and shows as Not Responding in Task Manager.  After waiting more than 5 minutes for a response we wind up ending the task.
fields.summary: Add ability to perform excel export with no html links

Sending mail - org.apache.velocity.runtime.exception.ReferenceException:

fields.description:
Our main production jira works fine.

However, we have done a csv import into a test server - and the component&version fields are missing from the full content  view.
They are there when viewing issues individually.... but the full content seems to be ... well, not quite full..

It must be something to do with the import...

I will upload our test data to zeus (the hsqldb files)

-Nick
fields.summary: Full Content in issue navigator isnt showing all fields (component and version missing)

fields.description: As I am getting used to using Alt-S to submit forms, (and training users to do the same), I notice the Attach Screenshot (popup) does not support this feature.
fields.summary: Alt-S does not submit form on attach screenshot

fields.description:
I'am trying to install jira 3.3 on Windows as a service.

Explanations found in http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.3/runasservice.html are no more correct for version 3.3.

Could you provide the new command line for Tomcat 5.

Cheers,
Pierre-Yves
fields.summary: "Install Jira as A service" chapter not updated for Tomcat 5.x

fields.description: We sometimes get support requests from users who are having issues with configuring their dashboard. Since some of them are abroad (from the helpdesk), the helpdesk admins cannot walk physically to help with the configuration and handling the issues is often hard over the phone, especially given sometimes long time differences. To provide help efficiently, an administrator should be able to pick a specific user and edit their dashboard settings. This could be achieved by the user telling the admin their password but it's such a bad security practice that it cannot be used in practice.
fields.summary: Administrators should be able to edit specific user's dashboards

fields.description:
I would like to acces the link information between issues via the SOAP API.

So there should be a class similar to  "RemoteIssue", let's say "RemoteLink"  that covers the details of the links (type, source issue, target issue).

A method 
public RemoteLink[] getLinks()
should be added to the RemoteIssue-Class, maybe with some convenience methods that do some filtering (like getLinks(LinkType type) that only return certain Links.

Or maybe it could be wrapped, so that the links are followed immediately without the step over the Links
public RemoteIssue[] getIssues (LinkType which);
that returns all linked issues that are linked via the linktype LinkType.

It should also be possible to create Links, either explicitly:
Link l = new Link (RemoteIssue from, RemoteIssue to, LinkType type)

or directly on the RemoteIssue class.

I would really be happy to see a feature like this in one of the next Jira versions.
fields.summary: Ability to access and create link information via SOAP

fields.description: It would be great if you could deliver a distribution containing both Jira sources and the standalone distribution. We would like to version control this distribution into CVS and get an easy way to modify and test our changes : checkout the module, realize the changes, build and then start the application. We would like to avoid separating Jira sources into CVS and the standalone distribution elsewhere on a server where the user will have to go to download the folder and then copy the "atlassian-jira" folder into. When new persons are in charge of the maintenance of such projects, which are using commercial products, even if it is well documented, those persons will perhaps have problems during the process. Another argument is that, if we don't have the standalone distribution into CVS, we will have to remember that this folder must regularly be updated if you realize upgrades like the one you did for Tomcat 5.5.9. I think that it is worth to put everything into CVS even if we don't modify files into the standalone distribution.
fields.summary: Delivering a standalone source distribution

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-7612].
  {panel}

The plugin available at http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRACOM/Available+Worklflow+Actions+Customfield should be included in jira. However instead of making a custom field directly a field that ONLY exists for issue navigator should be considered.

From email:
One of the nice things about sub tasks is that the workflow actions are
in the task in an easy to use manor. Can this type of display be added to
the navigator for all issue types? I know that a plug-in was written for
that and posted to confluence, but it has a few quirks and it would be nice
to have an official implementation.
fields.summary: Integrate the 'Available Workflow Actions' CF into Jira

fields.description:
We have some issue types, statuses and components with long names.  I have done a test upgrade to Jira 3.3 and the find issue panel is too large with some elements spilling over onto the issue navigator space.  This doesn't affect our current production environment using Jira 3.2.2.   IE is not affected.

(This has  been tested with firefox 1.0.4 and DeerPark Nightly build from 2005-08-10)
fields.summary: Find Issues menu too large in firefox

fields.description:
Works find in IE6 - but in IE5.5, the Issue Navigator can become unreadable if there is a long summary - as all the fields are pushed right, rather than the cell text wrapping.

We have a lot of users (>1000) on IE 5.5 :-(
fields.summary: Issue Navigator fields dont wrap in IE5.5

fields.description:
In the Affects Versions and Fix Versions multi-select field, the separators dont show - instead all of the versions are displayed without separation

It makes the versions field very confusing as all of the issues appear out of order.

I will attach screenshots...

We have a lot (>1000) of users on NT4 and IE 5.5 :-(
fields.summary: Versions field separators (Released Versions, Unreleased Versions) dont appear in IE5.5

fields.summary: excel output incorrectly placing issue descriptions into multiple rows

fields.description:
See attached Excel file, generated from Atlassian's support site, which includes this issue (JRA-7597?). Doesn't matter if All fields or Current Fields chosen, get the same result. Notice how for issues JRA-7596 and JRA-7595, the description has all or portions underlined as a hyperlink, because the issue description contains a link to another JIRA issue, and the Excel output has placed a hyperlink around whole sections of text where the hyperlink exists. Similarly, for issue JRA-7485 which simply has text referring to a sample emailaddress@fakedomain.com.
It would certainly be up for discussion whether any attempt to include links like this in Excel should be done at all - in my opinion - NO! It certainly doesn't present itself in previous versions - But even if this will a "feature" I'd have to live with, it should certainly only link the appropriate text. For now, I will assume that it was unintentional to produce Excel output with any sort of link in the issue description column.
fields.summary: excel output has added hyperlinks to issue descriptions

fields.description: When clicking on Filters popup, and then Manage, the filter area (left pane) does not display properly. See attachment with 3.2.3 on the left and 3.3 on the right. On I.E. it seems to render OK. May be related to JRA-7593.
fields.summary: manage filters pane missing

fields.description:
I am testing issue JRA-5939 on version 3.3 to see if the sorting has been fixed. It does not appear to have been.
To see the problem, run any filter (say the one called "3.3" for JIRA). The filter default is Key descending. I want to sort by:
1) Component ascending, then 2) Assignee ascending, then 3) Priority descending.
So, first I click on Priority:
 Sorted by: Priority ascending, then Key descending 
Then I click on Priority again:
 Sorted by: Priority descending, then Key descending 
Then I click on Assignee:
 Sorted by: Assign To ascending, then Priority descending, then Key descending 
So far so good...
Then I click on Components:
Sorted by: Component/s ascending, then Priority descending, then Key descending 

Whoops... that's not supposed to happen... what happened to my assignee sort?
fields.summary: issue navigator STILL doesn't sort by requested columns

fields.description:
After pressing one of the pre-set filters from the browse project page, the filter results are shown, but the left pane that usually has the filter operations (e.g. Edit, Save, etc.) is missing.
This behaviour is CRUCIAL to the way I do training of JIRA. I show users to use any of the canned filters, and then edit it to suite their needs. For example, if you are looking for all issues you reported with the word "xyz", then run the pre-set filter and then edit the filter to include the query string. 
It looks like this is broken only on Firefox. It works as expected on I.E.
fields.summary: edit filter pane/menu missing from preset filters

fields.description:
Using 3.1 Beta Build #92 the calendar pop-up does not always show (see screenshot).

Nothing in the logs.

This is reproductible both with firefox and internet explorer

The server is running on a windows 2k workstation
fields.summary: Calendar pop-up not showing sometimes without further error

fields.description:
When sending an email notification of an event, the email template should include the Issue Security Level if the notification is sent to a user privileged to see (edit) the level. Given that this field is very significant if the value is set, it should be in the standard template.

I tried to search for an issue about this for 10 minutes and didn't find this so I'm assuming it's not implemented in newer Jira versions.
fields.summary: Email template should include Issue Level Security field information

fields.description:
JIRA analyses entered text for URLs, and tries to retrieve their contents to check whether the linked-to page accepts trackback pings.  If  retrieving the page contents takes a long time or hangs, the JIRA mail queue is effectively frozen.  There doesn't appear to be a timeout in the code (or httpclient) to abort hung connections.

When JIRA is in such a state, clicking the 'flush queue' link returns immediately with no effect.  Taking a thread dump ('kill -3') shows the stuck thread:
